faxes.description: A list of fax telephone numbers

extension.description: The extension of the local communication number.  In the case of a Telephone Number accessing a Pager Network, the extension may be the Pager Identification Number required to leave a message for the Pager Number (i.e. Pager Pin).  These are mutually exclusive.

formattedNumber.description: The formatted telephone number.  The component parts of the telephone are put together into a presentation pattern as defined by the regex format specified.  Please note that \ is used as an escape character in regex, but a double \ is needed to escape within the json schema.  The regex will accept +CC NNNNNNNNNNNNNN where + is the symbol indicating the caller to enter their country specific code to call from outside the country.  CC is the country code for an international number (optional), and the area code and dial number.  The local access code (i.e. 1 (201) 333 4444. 1 is the access code in US) is not passed.  The UI will present the phone number following its own presentation convention

access.description: National Direct Dialing Prefix.  Also known as the trunk prefix or National Prefix.  It is the number to be dialed in a domestic telephone call, preceding any necessary area code and subscriber number (i.e. dial number).  When calling from outside of the country, the national direct dial prefix is omitted by the caller.  In Australia, Germany, and United Kingdom the trunk prefix is 0.  In the US and Canada it is 1.

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

areaDialing.description: The local area dialing code for a telephone number.

countryDialing.description: The country dialing code is the national prefix to be used when dialing TO that particular country FROM another country.

dialNumber.description: The local communication number, not including country dialing or area dialing codes.   If component parts of the telephone number are being communicated then the dialNumber is required.

landlines.description: A list of land-line telephone numbers

metaType_v02.description: Meta contains the metadata associated with a response.  A GET response may include metadata to support pagination

totalNumber.description: Number of total instance resources in an instance resource set. Note: An instance resource set is a set of instance resources that is determined by a server to satisfy the sets membership criteria (i.e., selection, filter, expansion and search criteria) of a resource management operation (e.g. GET request) upon a collection resource

startSequence.description: The instance resource sequence (number) identifying the first resource returned in the response. The server generates this sequence.  It is used by the client to determine the start sequence of the subsequent Get request

links.description: A link description object is used to describe link relations.  In the context of a schema, it defines the link relations of the instances of the schema, and can be parameterized by the instance values.  The link description format can be used on its own in regular (non-schema documents), and use of this format can be declared by referencing the normative link description schema as the the schema for the data structure that uses the links

completeIndicator.description: Indicates whether the response completes the return of all of the resources of the instance resource set to the requesting system

durationType_v01.description: Represents the duration of time as represented by ISO 8601. Where the value space is a six dimensional space where the coordinates designate the Gregorian year, month, day, hour, minute, and second. The number of seconds can include decimal digits to arbitary pecision. PnYn MnDTnH nMnS, where: [n] is replaced by the value for each of the date and time elements that follow the [n]. Leading zeros are not required, but the maximum number of digits for each element should be agreed to by the communicating parties. The capital letters 'P', 'Y', 'M', 'W', 'D', 'T', 'H', 'M', and 'S' are designators for each of the date and time elements and are not replaced. P is the duration designator (historically called 'period') placed at the start of the duration representation. Y is the year designator that follows the value for the number of years. M is the month designator that follows the value for the number of months. D is the day designator that follows the value for the number of days. T is the time designator that precedes the time components of the representation. H is the hour designator that follows the value for the number of hours. M is the minute designator that follows the value for the number of minutes. S is the second designator that follows the value for the number of seconds. The number of seconds can include decimal digits to arbitrary precision

amountValue.description: The numeric value associated to the rate. In the example 5 US dollars per hour, the number 5 is the rate value. In the example 3 bags of rice per month, the number 3 is the rate value. In the example, 20 percent of annual sales, the amountValue would be 20

baseMultiplierValue.description: For any given rate, the base rate value is presumed to be 1, e.g. per one hour, per one month. If for example, the rate was 10 US dollars for every widget produced, the base rate value is presumed to be one and there is no need to communicate a baseMultiplierValue. If however, the rate was 10 US Dollars for every 3 widgets produced, the baseMultiplierValue would be 3

baseUnitCode.description: For any given rate, the baseUnitCode is used to define the denominator of the rate, or rate over what. In the example 5 US dollars per hour, the baseUnitCode is hour. In the example 3 bags of rice per month, the baseUnitCode is month. If for example, the rate was 10 US dollars for every widget produced, the baseUnitCode would be widget. In the example, 20 percent of annual sales, the baseUnitCode would equate to annual sales

unitCode.description: For any given rate, either the currencyCode or the unitCode is present. In the example 3 bags of rice per month, currencyCode would not be present, and the unitCode would be bags of rice. In the example, 20 percent of annual sales, the unitCode would be percent

currencyCode.description: List of standard currency codes ISO 4217 For any given rate, either the currencyCode or the unitCode is present. In the example 5 US dollars per hour, the unitCode would not be present, and the currency code would be USD

associateOIDType_v02.description: The unique identifier of an assoicate

customFieldContainerType_v02.description: A container of custom fields. The category within each custom object allows for the categorizing or grouping of the associated custom field for the purpose of data mining. For example, the typeCode on a custom string object might be valued as SIZE and the correlating name codes might be t-shirt, pants, jacket, etc.

extension.description: The extension of the local communication number.  In the case of a Telephone Number accessing a Pager Network, the extension may be the Pager Identification Number required to leave a message for the Pager Number (i.e. Pager Pin).  These are mutually exclusive.

formattedNumber.description: The formatted telephone number.  The component parts of the telephone are put together into a presentation pattern as defined by the regex format specified.  Please note that \ is used as an escape character in regex, but a double \ is needed to escape within the json schema.  The regex will accept +CC NNNNNNNNNNNNNN where + is the symbol indicating the caller to enter their country specific code to call from outside the country.  CC is the country code for an international number (optional), and the area code and dial number.  The local access code (i.e. 1 (201) 333 4444. 1 is the access code in US) is not passed.  The UI will present the phone number following its own presentation convention

access.description: National Direct Dialing Prefix.  Also known as the trunk prefix or National Prefix.  It is the number to be dialed in a domestic telephone call, preceding any necessary area code and subscriber number (i.e. dial number).  When calling from outside of the country, the national direct dial prefix is omitted by the caller.  In Australia, Germany, and United Kingdom the trunk prefix is 0.  In the US and Canada it is 1.

nickName.description: A preferred name, e.g. a nickname

items.description: Person titles

formattedName.description: A formatted version of the person name

givenName.description: The first name of the person

typeCode.description: The type of former name, e.g. pre-union or legal

scriptCode.description: The type of script the name is in. Associated codelist is ISO15924-A. Use the alpha-4 representation versus the single digit numeric representation. Format is lowercase with inital letter capitalized. For example, Cyrillic is Cyrl

items.description: Person title Prefix Codes

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

generationAffixCode.description: The generational affix of the person name, e.g. Jr, Sr

genderCode.description: The gender of a person, e.g. Male, Female

workAuthorizationDocuments.description: A list of documents that authorize work, e.g. visas, a work permit, a labor card, etc.

countryCode.description: Country with which the associated document is associated. ISO_3166-1-alpha-2 code list

issueDate.description: The issue date of the related identity document.  Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format.

issuingParty.description: An agency, bureau, or other organization issuing an associated identifier, license, or certificate; the body or persons exercising power or command. An issuing authority often is a government agency or official authority, but sometimes might be a private organization

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the identity document. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format.

typeCode.description: The type of document.

studentIndicator.description: Indicates that the person is student

tobaccoUserIndicator.description: Indicates that the person is a tobacco user.

ethnicityCode.description: An ethnic group is a group that regards itself or is regarded by others as a distinct community by virtue of certain characteristics that will help to distinguish the group from the surrounding community. Ethnicity is considered to be shared characteristics such as culture, language, religion, and traditions, which contribute to the identify of a person or group

disabledIndicator.description: Indicates that the person is disabled

religionCode.description: The religion code of the person

raceCode.description: Race is a classification system used to categorize humans into large and distinct populations or groups by heritable phenotypic characteristics, geographic ancestry, culture, history, language, physical appearance, ethnicity, and social status

identificationMethodCode.description: The method by which the associated data is collected or associated with the given person. Generally the values are self-identification or self-reporting,and observer-reporting

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity

longName.description: Long description of the related code

workAssignment.description: An object describing the details of a work assignment. A work assignment pertains to the duties and responsibilities that should be performed by the worker

workerStatus.description: The status of the worker in the organization at the highest level. If a given worker has multiple relationships with the organization, this is the status that arches over all those relationships

associateOID.description: A unique identifier of an associate

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

emailUri.description: The URI of the associated email address

faxes.description: A list of fax telephone numbers

extension.description: The extension of the local communication number.  In the case of a Telephone Number accessing a Pager Network, the extension may be the Pager Identification Number required to leave a message for the Pager Number (i.e. Pager Pin).  These are mutually exclusive.

formattedNumber.description: The formatted telephone number.  The component parts of the telephone are put together into a presentation pattern as defined by the regex format specified.  Please note that \ is used as an escape character in regex, but a double \ is needed to escape within the json schema.  The regex will accept +CC NNNNNNNNNNNNNN where + is the symbol indicating the caller to enter their country specific code to call from outside the country.  CC is the country code for an international number (optional), and the area code and dial number.  The local access code (i.e. 1 (201) 333 4444. 1 is the access code in US) is not passed.  The UI will present the phone number following its own presentation convention

access.description: National Direct Dialing Prefix.  Also known as the trunk prefix or National Prefix.  It is the number to be dialed in a domestic telephone call, preceding any necessary area code and subscriber number (i.e. dial number).  When calling from outside of the country, the national direct dial prefix is omitted by the caller.  In Australia, Germany, and United Kingdom the trunk prefix is 0.  In the US and Canada it is 1.

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

areaDialing.description: The local area dialing code for a telephone number.

countryDialing.description: The country dialing code is the national prefix to be used when dialing TO that particular country FROM another country.

dialNumber.description: The local communication number, not including country dialing or area dialing codes.   If component parts of the telephone number are being communicated then the dialNumber is required.

landlines.description: A list of land-line telephone numbers

extension.description: The extension of the local communication number.  In the case of a Telephone Number accessing a Pager Network, the extension may be the Pager Identification Number required to leave a message for the Pager Number (i.e. Pager Pin).  These are mutually exclusive.

socialNetworks.description: A list of social networks addresses

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

uri.description: The URI of the associated email address

workerDates.description: These dates are related to the highest level legal relationship that a person has with the organization. If a given worker has multiple relationships with the organization, these are the dates associated with the primary relationship.
workerDates.title: WorkerDatesOutput

originalHireDate.description: The date the worker is first hired into an organization. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

terminationDate.description: The date an employee is terminated. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

acquisitionDate.description: The date the worker was aquired via a merger or acquisition. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

rehireDate.description: The date the worker is rehired into an organization. If there are multiple dates of rehire, this is the most current. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

expectedTerminationDate.description: Expected date when employee is terminated. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

retirementDate.description: The date an employee is terminated. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

adjustedServiceDate.description: A date related to the length of time a worker works in a given work assignment which usually factors into eligibility for various types of benefits. It is generally adjusted for workers that leave the organization and are later rehired. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

wageLawCoverageType_v02.description: A code indicating whether the work assignment is covered under applicable wage and labor laws relating to working hours, overtime, and similar protections, e.g. FLSA in the US

wageLawNameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated wage law entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

coverageCode.description: The wage hour coverage code, e.g. exempt, non-exempt

linkType_v02.description: A link description object is used to describe link relations.  In the context of a schema, it defines the link relations of the instances of the schema, and can be parameterized by the instance values.  The link description format can be used on its own in regular (non-schema documents), and use of this format can be declared by referencing the normative link description schema as the the schema for the data structure that uses the links

schema.description: This property contains a schema which defines the acceptable structure of the submitted request.  For a GET request, this schema would define the properties for the query string and for a POST request, this would define the body

encType.description: If present, this property indicates a query media type format that the server supports for querying or posting to the collection of instances at the target resource.  The query can be suffixed to the target URI to query the collection with property-based constraints on the resources that SHOULD be returned from the server or used to post data to the resource (depending on the method). (Request)

targetSchema.description: This property is a schema that defines the expected structure of the JSON representation of the target of the link, if the target of the link is returned using JSON representation

argumentValue.description: Code value (typically a key field) of the code list item

argumentPath.description: Code value (typically a key field) of the code list item

method.description: The HTTP method code (HTTP Verb) traverse the link (GET, POST, PUT or DELETE)

canonicalUri.description: A unique identifier of the feature/function/operation, the link poins to

rel.description: Indicates the nature of the relationship of the related resource to the resource that generated this representation

mediaType.description: The media type that the linked resource will return (Response)

title.description: This property defines a title for the link.  The value must be a string. User agents MAY use this title when presenting the link to the user

locationType_v02.description: Schema to describe details of a location

address.description: An address related to the associated entity

nameCode.description: The location type code and description, e.g. HDQ, headquarters

itemIDType_v01.description: The unique identifier of the object in a collection

workAssignmentType_v02.description: A work assignment pertains to the duties and responsibilities that should be performed by the worker

remunerationBasisCode.description: The remuneration basis code is a way of classifying a work assignment as salaried, salaried plus commission, commission only, hourly or daily

payrollScheduleGroupID.description: Clients can use the payroll schedule group to pay multiple groups of workers with different pay cycle codes or period end dates within the same payroll group

terminationDate.description: The date the worker stops working in a given work assignment. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

annualBenefitBaseRate.description: The annual benefits base rate that can be different from the employee's annual base rate

officerIndicator.description: Indicates whether the worker is classified as an officer. This may be used to track regulatory compliance

executiveIndicator.description: Indicates whether the worker is classified as an executive. This may be used to identify applicable benefits and compensation programs

assignmentTermCode.description: This describes whether a work assignment has a known end date. If the assignment does not have a scheduled or known end date, it is considerd a regular or permanent assignment. If an assignment has a known or scheduled end date, it is considered a temporary or fixed term assignment

highlyCompensatedIndicator.description: Indicates whether the worker is classifier as highly compensated. This may be used by regulatory bodies to determine appropriate tax program assignments

minimumPayGradeStepDuration.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time a worker must remain in a given pay step before

compaRatio.description: Compa-ratio is the mathematical relationship between the average actual salaries within a pay grade range and the midpoint of that range. It is used to understand how a worker is paid relative to the market-rate for comparable jobs

payScaleCode.description: A pay scale is a graded compensation system that determines how much a worker is to be paid as a wage or salary, e.g. the General Schedule used to pay US civil servants, the U.S. uniformed services pay grades and the salary grades by which United States military personnel are paid are paid

occupationalClassifications.description: A reference to a system used to classify workers into occupational categories for the purpose of collecting, calculating, or disseminating data. In the US, an example of this is the EEOC system; in the UK, an example of this is the SOC system. This is the at the assignment level in France

classificationCode.description: The classification code of the associated entity.

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

vipIndicator.description: Indicates whether a worker has status as a VIP within a particular context. This may be used to determine benefit plan participation or to afford VIPs expedited services or special handling

expectedStartDate.description: The date the worker is expected to show up for work. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

fullTimeEquivalenceRatio.description: Full-time equivalent (FTE) is a unit that indicates the workload of an employed person (or student) in a way that makes workloads comparable across various contexts. FTE is often used to measure the involvement of a worker in a project, or to track cost reductions in an organization. An FTE of 1.0 means that the person is equivalent to a full-time worker, while an FTE of 0.5 signals that the worker is only half-time

payrollProcessingStatusCode.description: The status of the worker in the payroll system

expectedTerminationDate.description: The expected date when the worker stops working in a given work assignment. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

wageLawCoverage.description: A code indicating whether the work assignment is covered under applicable wage and labor laws relating to working hours, overtime, and similar protections, e.g. FLSA in the US

geographicPayDifferentialPercentage.description: A geographic pay differential is additional compensation paid to a worker to account for variations in cost of labor or cost of living based on location and is expected to be communicated as an additional remuneration. This is a percent value that drives the calculation of that additional compensation. It is also used to modify the pay range associated to the pay grade in order to apply the appropriate adjustments to the compa ratio

nationalityContextCode.description: A code classifying the status of an employee or other resource as one of the following - Domestic - A person who resides in the same country in which the employer is based. Inpatriate - An employee of a multinational company who is from a foreign country but transferred from a foreign subdivision to the home country of the corporation. Expatriate - An employee or resource involved in the foreign-based operations of an employer who is a national or who regularly resides within the base country of the employer. Third-Party National - An employee involved in the foreign-based operations of an employer who is not a national of the country where the operations nor the base country of the employer. Local National - An employee involved in the foreign-based operations of an employer who is a national or who regularly resides in the country where those operations are based. Detached - Employees working in another country who do not have the status of expatriate (In France, for example, when the length of the expatriation is less than 2 years)

workerProbationIndicator.description: Indicates if the worker is under probation

standardHours.description: The standard number of hours of work associated to a position, typically used to drive the definition of a full time assignment, e.g. 40 in the US, 37.5 in the UK, 35 in FR. This number is usually expressed based on a week. The unitCode is used to convey that measurement

items.description: The ASSIGNED organizational unit is one for which the work assignment is doing work
items.title: AssignedOrganizationalUnitItem

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated organizational unit entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

typeCode.description: The organizational unit code and description, e.g. department code.

workLevelCode.description: The work level code, e.g. Fulltime, Parttime

nextPayGradeStepDate.description: The date of the related entity. Data Representation Standard: Temporal Data Specification which follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

highlyCompensatedTypeCode.description: The type of highly compensated worker.

legalEntityID.description: The identifier of the legal entity (I.e. Organization).

workArrangementCode.description: A work arrangement describes the time and place that work gets done on a regular basis. For example, a work assignment can be fully office based, fully field based, fully home based, or some combination thereof

offerExtensionDate.description: The date a worker is extended an offer for a work assignment. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

seniorityDate.description: A date related to the length of time a worker works in a given work assignment or job. This is sometimes tracked at the work assignment level in support of union contracts. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

industryClassifications.description: The occupational classification reflects the type of job or work that the person does, while the industry classification reflects the business activity of their employer or company. The occupational and industry classifications are based on a persons sole or primary job, unless otherwise specified. For the unemployed, the occupation and industry are based on the last job held. An example of an industry classification code in the US is the NAICS code.

classificationCode.description: The classification code of the associated entity.

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

payrollGroupCode.description: The payroll group relevant to payroll processing for this work assignment

homeOrganizationalUnits.description: A list of the various types of home organizational units

items.description: The HOME organizational unit defines the work assignment and perhaps funds it. The should only be one home organizational unit for a given type, e.g. only one home department.
items.title: HomeOrganizationalUnitItem

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated organizational unit entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

typeCode.description: The organizational unit code and description, e.g. department code.

additionalRemunerations.description: A list of pay compensations associated to a given work assignment.  Additional remuneration includes all other forms of compensation beyond the base pay associated to a given work assignment.  The typeCode is used to further refine the type of compensation, e.g. bonus, commission, etc.

intervalCode.description: The interval describing how often the remuneration is paid

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

associatedRateQualifiers.description: Describes the conditions under which the associated rate can be expected

qualifierObjectTypeCode.description: Qualifier type e.g. department, environment, shift, etc.

effectiveDate.description: The effective date of the related entity. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format.

typeCode.description: The type of additional remuneration, e.g. bonus, commission, etc.

actualStartDate.description: The date the worker actually shows up for work. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

payCycleCode.description: Describes how often the payee is paid

stockOwnerIndicator.description: Indicates whether the worker is a stock owner. This may be used by regulatory bodies for tax purposes or for statutory reporting

assignmentStatus.description: The status of the work assignment

standardPayPeriodHours.description: The standard number of hours per pay period

baseRemuneration.description: The base or primary pay (i.e. salary, wage) associated to a work assignment. The structure allows for the explicit communication of pre-defined equivalents for the base remuneration

associatedRateQualifiers.description: Describes the conditions under which the associated rate can be expected

qualifierObjectTypeCode.description: Qualifier type e.g. department, environment, shift, etc.

recordingBasisCode.description: Describes how the remuneration is recorded in the given system, e.g. hourly, daily, weekly, etc.

effectiveDate.description: The effective date of the related entity. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format.

payGradeStepPayRate.description: The rate associated with the pay step

hireDate.description: The date the worker is hired into a work assignment. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

homeWorkLocation.description: The home work location is the location out of which the work assignment is based. It does not necessarily mean that the worker is physically located in that location. This data becomes relevant for affirmative action reasons. In the US for example, if a worker works from home or a location where there is not an EEO-1 form/location, then the worker is accounted for based on the location of the reports to manager or work unit. Additionally, other things like market salaries, taxes, etc. would be aligned to home office location

managementPositionIndicator.description: The value true indicates that this position may manage people i.e. it may have positiions that report to it.

reportsTo.description: A reference list of workers to whom a given worker reports

items.description: The work assignment to whom a given worker reports
items.title: WorkAssignmentReportsTo

workerID.description: An identifier for a worker, e.g. an Employee ID, a Contractor ID or an Associate ID.

positionID.description: The unique identifier of the associated position

reportsToWorkerName.description: Reports to person name (if reporting to a person)

associateOID.description: A unique identifier of an associate

workerTypeCode.description: This describes the type of the worker in a given work assignment, e.g. permanent employee, fixed term employee, apprentice, vendor employee, volunteer, apprentice, independent contractor, etc.

payrollRegionCode.description: The region in which the payroll is processed

geographicPayDifferentialCode.description: A geographic pay differential is additional compensation paid to a worker to account for variations in cost of labor or cost of living based on location and is expected to be communicated as an additional remuneration. This is a coded field that is associated to a percent that drives the calculation of that additional compensation. It is also used to modify the pay range associated to the pay grade in order to apply the appropriate adjustments to the compa ratio

payGradeCode.description: A pay grade is a breakdown of a pay scale that is used to manage the compensation of a worker by providing a  a fixed framework of salary or wage ranges, as opposed to a free negotiation

payGradePayRange.description: The pay range of the pay grade

offerAcceptanceDate.description: The date a worker accepts an offer for a work assignment. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

bargainingUnit.description: The associated bargaining unit (local labor union)

nationalityContextCode.description: A code classifying the status of an employee or other resource as one of the following - Domestic - A person who resides in the same country in which the employer is based. Inpatriate - An employee of a multinational company who is from a foreign country but transferred from a foreign subdivision to the home country of the corporation. Expatriate - An employee or resource involved in the foreign-based operations of an employer who is a national or who regularly resides within the base country of the employer. Third-Party National - An employee involved in the foreign-based operations of an employer who is not a national of the country where the operations nor the base country of the employer. Local National - An employee involved in the foreign-based operations of an employer who is a national or who regularly resides in the country where those operations are based. Detached - Employees working in another country who do not have the status of expatriate (In France, for example, when the length of the expatriation is less than 2 years)

workerProbationIndicator.description: Indicates if the worker is under probation

standardHours.description: The standard number of hours of work associated to a position, typically used to drive the definition of a full time assignment, e.g. 40 in the US, 37.5 in the UK, 35 in FR. This number is usually expressed based on a week. The unitCode is used to convey that measurement

items.description: The ASSIGNED organizational unit is one for which the work assignment is doing work
items.title: WorkAssignmentTransformAssignedOrganizationalUnitItem

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated organizational unit entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

typeCode.description: The organizational unit code and description, e.g. department code.

workLevelCode.description: The work level code, e.g. Fulltime, Parttime

nextPayGradeStepDate.description: The date of the related entity. Data Representation Standard: Temporal Data Specification which follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

highlyCompensatedTypeCode.description: The type of highly compensated worker.

legalEntityID.description: The unique identifier within the organization that identifies the legal entity that the work assignment is related to.

workArrangementCode.description: A work arrangement describes the time and place that work gets done on a regular basis. For example, a work assignment can be fully office based, fully field based, fully home based, or some combination thereof

offerExtensionDate.description: The date a worker is extended an offer for a work assignment. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

seniorityDate.description: A date related to the length of time a worker works in a given work assignment or job. This is sometimes tracked at the work assignment level in support of union contracts. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

industryClassifications.description: The occupational classification reflects the type of job or work that the person does, while the industry classification reflects the business activity of their employer or company. The occupational and industry classifications are based on a persons sole or primary job, unless otherwise specified. For the unemployed, the occupation and industry are based on the last job held. An example of an industry classification code in the US is the NAICS code.

classificationCode.description: The classification code of the associated entity.

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

payrollGroupCode.description: The payroll group relevant to payroll processing for this work assignment

homeOrganizationalUnits.description: A list of the various types of home organizational units

items.description: The HOME organizational unit defines the work assignment and perhaps funds it. The should only be one home organizational unit for a given type, e.g. only one home department.

additionalRemunerations.description: A list of pay compensations associated to a given work assignment.  Additional remuneration includes all other forms of compensation beyond the base pay associated to a given work assignment.  The typeCode is used to further refine the type of compensation, e.g. bonus, commission, etc.

intervalCode.description: The interval describing how often the remuneration is paid

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

assignmentStatus.description: The status of the work assignment

standardPayPeriodHours.description: The standard number of hours per pay period

baseRemuneration.description: The base or primary pay (i.e. salary, wage) associated to a work assignment. The structure allows for the explicit communication of pre-defined equivalents for the base remuneration

recordingBasisCode.description: Describes how the remuneration is recorded in the given system, e.g. hourly, daily, weekly, etc.

payGradeStepPayRate.description: The rate associated with the pay step

hireDate.description: The date the worker is hired into a work assignment. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

homeWorkLocation.description: The home work location is the location out of which the work assignment is based. It does not necessarily mean that the worker is physically located in that location. This data becomes relevant for affirmative action reasons. In the US for example, if a worker works from home or a location where there is not an EEO-1 form/location, then the worker is accounted for based on the location of the reports to manager or work unit. Additionally, other things like market salaries, taxes, etc. would be aligned to home office location

managementPositionIndicator.description: The value true indicates that this position may manage people i.e. it may have positiions that report to it.

geographicPayDifferentialCode.description: A geographic pay differential is additional compensation paid to a worker to account for variations in cost of labor or cost of living based on location and is expected to be communicated as an additional remuneration. This is a coded field that is associated to a percent that drives the calculation of that additional compensation. It is also used to modify the pay range associated to the pay grade in order to apply the appropriate adjustments to the compa ratio

payGradeCode.description: A pay grade is a breakdown of a pay scale that is used to manage the compensation of a worker by providing a  a fixed framework of salary or wage ranges, as opposed to a free negotiation

extension.description: The extension of the local communication number.  In the case of a Telephone Number accessing a Pager Network, the extension may be the Pager Identification Number required to leave a message for the Pager Number (i.e. Pager Pin).  These are mutually exclusive.

formattedNumber.description: The formatted telephone number.  The component parts of the telephone are put together into a presentation pattern as defined by the regex format specified.  Please note that \ is used as an escape character in regex, but a double \ is needed to escape within the json schema.  The regex will accept +CC NNNNNNNNNNNNNN where + is the symbol indicating the caller to enter their country specific code to call from outside the country.  CC is the country code for an international number (optional), and the area code and dial number.  The local access code (i.e. 1 (201) 333 4444. 1 is the access code in US) is not passed.  The UI will present the phone number following its own presentation convention

access.description: National Direct Dialing Prefix.  Also known as the trunk prefix or National Prefix.  It is the number to be dialed in a domestic telephone call, preceding any necessary area code and subscriber number (i.e. dial number).  When calling from outside of the country, the national direct dial prefix is omitted by the caller.  In Australia, Germany, and United Kingdom the trunk prefix is 0.  In the US and Canada it is 1.

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

areaDialing.description: The local area dialing code for a telephone number.

countryDialing.description: The country dialing code is the national prefix to be used when dialing TO that particular country FROM another country.

dialNumber.description: The local communication number, not including country dialing or area dialing codes.   If component parts of the telephone number are being communicated then the dialNumber is required.

landlines.description: A list of land-line telephone numbers

extension.description: The extension of the local communication number.  In the case of a Telephone Number accessing a Pager Network, the extension may be the Pager Identification Number required to leave a message for the Pager Number (i.e. Pager Pin).  These are mutually exclusive.

formattedNumber.description: The formatted telephone number.  The component parts of the telephone are put together into a presentation pattern as defined by the regex format specified.  Please note that \ is used as an escape character in regex, but a double \ is needed to escape within the json schema.  The regex will accept +CC NNNNNNNNNNNNNN where + is the symbol indicating the caller to enter their country specific code to call from outside the country.  CC is the country code for an international number (optional), and the area code and dial number.  The local access code (i.e. 1 (201) 333 4444. 1 is the access code in US) is not passed.  The UI will present the phone number following its own presentation convention

durationType_v01.description: Represents the duration of time as represented by ISO 8601. Where the value space is a six dimensional space where the coordinates designate the Gregorian year, month, day, hour, minute, and second. The number of seconds can include decimal digits to arbitary pecision. PnYn MnDTnH nMnS, where: [n] is replaced by the value for each of the date and time elements that follow the [n]. Leading zeros are not required, but the maximum number of digits for each element should be agreed to by the communicating parties. The capital letters 'P', 'Y', 'M', 'W', 'D', 'T', 'H', 'M', and 'S' are designators for each of the date and time elements and are not replaced. P is the duration designator (historically called 'period') placed at the start of the duration representation. Y is the year designator that follows the value for the number of years. M is the month designator that follows the value for the number of months. D is the day designator that follows the value for the number of days. T is the time designator that precedes the time components of the representation. H is the hour designator that follows the value for the number of hours. M is the minute designator that follows the value for the number of minutes. S is the second designator that follows the value for the number of seconds. The number of seconds can include decimal digits to arbitrary precision

amountValue.description: The numeric value associated to the rate. In the example 5 US dollars per hour, the number 5 is the rate value. In the example 3 bags of rice per month, the number 3 is the rate value. In the example, 20 percent of annual sales, the amountValue would be 20

baseMultiplierValue.description: For any given rate, the base rate value is presumed to be 1, e.g. per one hour, per one month. If for example, the rate was 10 US dollars for every widget produced, the base rate value is presumed to be one and there is no need to communicate a baseMultiplierValue. If however, the rate was 10 US Dollars for every 3 widgets produced, the baseMultiplierValue would be 3

baseUnitCode.description: For any given rate, the baseUnitCode is used to define the denominator of the rate, or rate over what. In the example 5 US dollars per hour, the baseUnitCode is hour. In the example 3 bags of rice per month, the baseUnitCode is month. If for example, the rate was 10 US dollars for every widget produced, the baseUnitCode would be widget. In the example, 20 percent of annual sales, the baseUnitCode would equate to annual sales

unitCode.description: For any given rate, either the currencyCode or the unitCode is present. In the example 3 bags of rice per month, currencyCode would not be present, and the unitCode would be bags of rice. In the example, 20 percent of annual sales, the unitCode would be percent

currencyCode.description: List of standard currency codes ISO 4217 For any given rate, either the currencyCode or the unitCode is present. In the example 5 US dollars per hour, the unitCode would not be present, and the currency code would be USD

legalAddress.description: This is the primary residential address that  is used by an organization for payroll, taxation, and benefit program eligibility

militaryClassificationCodes.description: Person military classification, e.g. Armed Forces Medal Veteran, Disabled Veteran, etc.

legalName.description: The current legal name of the person in the associated context. For example, if the context is set to Germany, this equates to the legal name of the person in Germany.

militaryStatusCode.description: Person military status, e.g. Active, Active Reserve, etc

birthPlace.description: The place a person was born. This can have taxation impacts

maritalStatusCode.description: Person marital status, e.g. Married, Divorced, etc.

disabilityIdentificationDeclinedIndicato.description: This is to support legal requirements related to US OFCCP reporting.

disabilityTypeCodes.description: Person disabilites, e.g. Amputee, Hearing Impairment, etc.

sexualOrientationCode.description: To allow for employees to self-identify their sexual orientation status

deathDate.description: The date a person died. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

deceasedIndicator.description: Indicates that the person is deceased

preferredName.description: The preferred name of the person in the associated context. A preferred name is often a variation on the current name that that the person has indicated as preferred. It is the full name by which the person wishes to be known within the context of the organization.

alternatePreferredNames.description: Other preferred names of the person expressed in a different language or script

qualificationAffixCode.description: The qualification affix of the person name

nickName.description: A preferred name, e.g. a nickname

items.description: Person titles

formattedName.description: A formatted version of the person name

givenName.description: The first name of the person

languageCode.description: The language the name is expressed in

scriptCode.description: The type of script the name is in. Associated codelist is ISO15924-A. Use the alpha-4 representation versus the single digit numeric representation. Format is lowercase with inital letter capitalized. For example, Cyrillic is Cyrl

items.description: Person title Prefix Codes

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

generationAffixCode.description: The generational affix of the person name, e.g. Jr, Sr

identityDocuments.description: A list of identity documents, that serve as to confirm the identification of the holder , e.g. a birth certificate, an ID Card

countryCode.description: Country with which the associated document is associated. ISO_3166-1-alpha-2 code list

issueDate.description: The issue date of the related identity document.  Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format.

issuingParty.description: An agency, bureau, or other organization issuing an associated identifier, license, or certificate; the body or persons exercising power or command. An issuing authority often is a government agency or official authority, but sometimes might be a private organization

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the identity document. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format.

typeCode.description: The type of document.

otherPersonalAddresses.description: A list of addresses related to the associated entity

door.description: A reference to a particular door in the context of an address. e.g. Apartment Number

postalCode.description: The string of characters used to identify the postal code

stairCase.description: A reference to a particular staircase in the context of an address

geoCoordinate.description: The coordinates of the location of the address

scriptCode.description: The type of script the in which the associated entity is represented. Associated codelist is ISO15924-A. Use the alpha-4 representation versus the single digit numeric representation. Format is lowercase with initial letter capitalized. For example, Cyrillic is Cyrl

cityName.description: A city in the context of an address

lineFive.description: Line Five of Street Address Information

sameAsAddressLink.description: This link is used in conjunction with the sameAsAddressIndicator. If a given system support same as address functionality, this link will point to the address that a user has selected as being the same as the one in context. For example, if the address in context is a dependent address, and the user has indicated that the dependent address is the same as the legal address of the worker, this link would point to worker/id/person/legalAddress.

buildingNumber.description: The number of a building in the context of a physical address, e.g. House Number

lineOne.description: Line One of Street Address Information

lineThree.description: Line Three of Street Address Information

floor.description: A floor in the context of an address

sameAsAddressIndicator.description: This indicator is used to support the ability to say that one address is the same as another. For example, the address of a dependent is the same as that of a worker. If a given system supports this functionality, this field should be present and set to true. The meta component associated to an event that allows for the adding or changing of an address, should use the links array associated to the indicator to define the list of addresses from which the user can select to set the address in context to be the same as.

deliveryPoint.description: A way to identify a specific delivery location, e.g. a mail-stop

lineFour.description: Line Four of Street Address Information

typeCode.description: The type of the related address entity

buildingName.description: The name of a building in the context of a physical address, e.g. Rockefeller Center

unit.description: A unit in the context of an address, e.g. an Apartment Number or an Office

lineTwo.description: Line Two of Street Address Information

nameCode.description: A descriptive coded name of the address

plotID.description: A way to identify a building plot, e.g. a specific building construction site

countrySubdivisionLevel1.description: A country subdivision correlating to a administrative level one level below country. For example, in the United States, this would be a state

countrySubdivisionLevel2.description: A country subdivision correlating to a administrative level two levels below country. For example, in the United States, this might be a county

streetTypeCode.description: The type of street, e.g. Lane, Passage, Way

ethnicityGroupCode.description: An ethnic group that a given ethnicity belongs to

highestEducationLevelCode.description: The highest level of education acheived by a given person.

immigrationDocuments.description: A list of immigration documents for a person who is not a citizen of the country in which he or see resides , e.g. a passport, visa, alien registration card, aka, green card, residence permit, etc.

countryCode.description: Country with which the associated document is associated. ISO_3166-1-alpha-2 code list

authorizedStayDuration.description: The length of time the holder of the visa is permitted to stay in the issuing country. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

reentryRequirementDuration.description: The length of time the holder of the visa must wait before re-entering the issuing country, following the expiration of the visa. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

issueDate.description: The issue date of the related identity document.  Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format.

issuingParty.description: An agency, bureau, or other organization issuing an associated identifier, license, or certificate; the body or persons exercising power or command. An issuing authority often is a government agency or official authority, but sometimes might be a private organization

typeCode.description: The type of document.

militaryDischargeDate.description: The effective date of the related entity. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format.

genderIdentityCode.description: To allow for employees to self-identify their gender identity status

passports.description: A list of passport documents, issued by a national govenment which certifies the identiy and nationality of its holder

nickName.description: A preferred name, e.g. a nickname

givenName.description: The first name of the person

typeCode.description: The type of former name, e.g. pre-union or legal

items.description: Person title Prefix Codes

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

generationAffixCode.description: The generational affix of the person name, e.g. Jr, Sr

genderCode.description: The gender of a person, e.g. Male, Female

workAuthorizationDocuments.description: A list of documents that authorize work, e.g. visas, a work permit, a labor card, etc.

countryCode.description: Country with which the associated document is associated. ISO_3166-1-alpha-2 code list

issueDate.description: The issue date of the related identity document.  Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format.

issuingParty.description: An agency, bureau, or other organization issuing an associated identifier, license, or certificate; the body or persons exercising power or command. An issuing authority often is a government agency or official authority, but sometimes might be a private organization

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the identity document. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format.

typeCode.description: The type of document.

studentIndicator.description: Indicates that the person is student

tobaccoUserIndicator.description: Indicates that the person is a tobacco user.

ethnicityCode.description: An ethnic group is a group that regards itself or is regarded by others as a distinct community by virtue of certain characteristics that will help to distinguish the group from the surrounding community. Ethnicity is considered to be shared characteristics such as culture, language, religion, and traditions, which contribute to the identify of a person or group

disabledIndicator.description: Indicates that the person is disabled

religionCode.description: The religion code of the person

raceCode.description: Race is a classification system used to categorize humans into large and distinct populations or groups by heritable phenotypic characteristics, geographic ancestry, culture, history, language, physical appearance, ethnicity, and social status

identificationMethodCode.description: The method by which the associated data is collected or associated with the given person. Generally the values are self-identification or self-reporting,and observer-reporting

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity

longName.description: Long description of the related code

workAssignment.description: An object describing the details of a work assignment. A work assignment pertains to the duties and responsibilities that should be performed by the worker

workerStatus.description: The status of the worker in the organization at the highest level. If a given worker has multiple relationships with the organization, this is the status that arches over all those relationships

associateOID.description: A unique identifier of an associate

workerDates.description: These dates are related to the highest level legal relationship that a person has with the organization. If a given worker has multiple relationships with the organization, these are the dates associated with the primary relationship.
workerDates.title: WorkerDatesOutput

originalHireDate.description: The date the worker is first hired into an organization. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

terminationDate.description: The date an employee is terminated. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

acquisitionDate.description: The date the worker was aquired via a merger or acquisition. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

rehireDate.description: The date the worker is rehired into an organization. If there are multiple dates of rehire, this is the most current. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

expectedTerminationDate.description: Expected date when employee is terminated. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

retirementDate.description: The date an employee is terminated. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

adjustedServiceDate.description: A date related to the length of time a worker works in a given work assignment which usually factors into eligibility for various types of benefits. It is generally adjusted for workers that leave the organization and are later rehired. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

wageLawCoverageType_v02.description: A code indicating whether the work assignment is covered under applicable wage and labor laws relating to working hours, overtime, and similar protections, e.g. FLSA in the US

wageLawNameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated wage law entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

coverageCode.description: The wage hour coverage code, e.g. exempt, non-exempt

linkType_v02.description: A link description object is used to describe link relations.  In the context of a schema, it defines the link relations of the instances of the schema, and can be parameterized by the instance values.  The link description format can be used on its own in regular (non-schema documents), and use of this format can be declared by referencing the normative link description schema as the the schema for the data structure that uses the links

schema.description: This property contains a schema which defines the acceptable structure of the submitted request.  For a GET request, this schema would define the properties for the query string and for a POST request, this would define the body

encType.description: If present, this property indicates a query media type format that the server supports for querying or posting to the collection of instances at the target resource.  The query can be suffixed to the target URI to query the collection with property-based constraints on the resources that SHOULD be returned from the server or used to post data to the resource (depending on the method). (Request)

targetSchema.description: This property is a schema that defines the expected structure of the JSON representation of the target of the link, if the target of the link is returned using JSON representation

argumentValue.description: Code value (typically a key field) of the code list item

argumentPath.description: Code value (typically a key field) of the code list item

method.description: The HTTP method code (HTTP Verb) traverse the link (GET, POST, PUT or DELETE)

canonicalUri.description: A unique identifier of the feature/function/operation, the link poins to

rel.description: Indicates the nature of the relationship of the related resource to the resource that generated this representation

mediaType.description: The media type that the linked resource will return (Response)

title.description: This property defines a title for the link.  The value must be a string. User agents MAY use this title when presenting the link to the user

locationType_v02.description: Schema to describe details of a location

address.description: An address related to the associated entity

nameCode.description: The location type code and description, e.g. HDQ, headquarters

itemIDType_v01.description: The unique identifier of the object in a collection

workAssignmentType_v02.description: A work assignment pertains to the duties and responsibilities that should be performed by the worker

remunerationBasisCode.description: The remuneration basis code is a way of classifying a work assignment as salaried, salaried plus commission, commission only, hourly or daily

payrollScheduleGroupID.description: Clients can use the payroll schedule group to pay multiple groups of workers with different pay cycle codes or period end dates within the same payroll group

terminationDate.description: The date the worker stops working in a given work assignment. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

annualBenefitBaseRate.description: The annual benefits base rate that can be different from the employee's annual base rate

officerIndicator.description: Indicates whether the worker is classified as an officer. This may be used to track regulatory compliance

executiveIndicator.description: Indicates whether the worker is classified as an executive. This may be used to identify applicable benefits and compensation programs

assignmentTermCode.description: This describes whether a work assignment has a known end date. If the assignment does not have a scheduled or known end date, it is considerd a regular or permanent assignment. If an assignment has a known or scheduled end date, it is considered a temporary or fixed term assignment

highlyCompensatedIndicator.description: Indicates whether the worker is classifier as highly compensated. This may be used by regulatory bodies to determine appropriate tax program assignments

minimumPayGradeStepDuration.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time a worker must remain in a given pay step before

compaRatio.description: Compa-ratio is the mathematical relationship between the average actual salaries within a pay grade range and the midpoint of that range. It is used to understand how a worker is paid relative to the market-rate for comparable jobs

payScaleCode.description: A pay scale is a graded compensation system that determines how much a worker is to be paid as a wage or salary, e.g. the General Schedule used to pay US civil servants, the U.S. uniformed services pay grades and the salary grades by which United States military personnel are paid are paid

occupationalClassifications.description: A reference to a system used to classify workers into occupational categories for the purpose of collecting, calculating, or disseminating data. In the US, an example of this is the EEOC system; in the UK, an example of this is the SOC system. This is the at the assignment level in France

classificationCode.description: The classification code of the associated entity.

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

vipIndicator.description: Indicates whether a worker has status as a VIP within a particular context. This may be used to determine benefit plan participation or to afford VIPs expedited services or special handling

expectedStartDate.description: The date the worker is expected to show up for work. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

fullTimeEquivalenceRatio.description: Full-time equivalent (FTE) is a unit that indicates the workload of an employed person (or student) in a way that makes workloads comparable across various contexts. FTE is often used to measure the involvement of a worker in a project, or to track cost reductions in an organization. An FTE of 1.0 means that the person is equivalent to a full-time worker, while an FTE of 0.5 signals that the worker is only half-time

payrollProcessingStatusCode.description: The status of the worker in the payroll system

expectedTerminationDate.description: The expected date when the worker stops working in a given work assignment. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

wageLawCoverage.description: A code indicating whether the work assignment is covered under applicable wage and labor laws relating to working hours, overtime, and similar protections, e.g. FLSA in the US

geographicPayDifferentialPercentage.description: A geographic pay differential is additional compensation paid to a worker to account for variations in cost of labor or cost of living based on location and is expected to be communicated as an additional remuneration. This is a percent value that drives the calculation of that additional compensation. It is also used to modify the pay range associated to the pay grade in order to apply the appropriate adjustments to the compa ratio

nationalityContextCode.description: A code classifying the status of an employee or other resource as one of the following - Domestic - A person who resides in the same country in which the employer is based. Inpatriate - An employee of a multinational company who is from a foreign country but transferred from a foreign subdivision to the home country of the corporation. Expatriate - An employee or resource involved in the foreign-based operations of an employer who is a national or who regularly resides within the base country of the employer. Third-Party National - An employee involved in the foreign-based operations of an employer who is not a national of the country where the operations nor the base country of the employer. Local National - An employee involved in the foreign-based operations of an employer who is a national or who regularly resides in the country where those operations are based. Detached - Employees working in another country who do not have the status of expatriate (In France, for example, when the length of the expatriation is less than 2 years)

workerProbationIndicator.description: Indicates if the worker is under probation

standardHours.description: The standard number of hours of work associated to a position, typically used to drive the definition of a full time assignment, e.g. 40 in the US, 37.5 in the UK, 35 in FR. This number is usually expressed based on a week. The unitCode is used to convey that measurement

items.description: The ASSIGNED organizational unit is one for which the work assignment is doing work
items.title: AssignedOrganizationalUnitItem

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated organizational unit entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

typeCode.description: The organizational unit code and description, e.g. department code.

workLevelCode.description: The work level code, e.g. Fulltime, Parttime

nextPayGradeStepDate.description: The date of the related entity. Data Representation Standard: Temporal Data Specification which follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

highlyCompensatedTypeCode.description: The type of highly compensated worker.

legalEntityID.description: The identifier of the legal entity (I.e. Organization).

workArrangementCode.description: A work arrangement describes the time and place that work gets done on a regular basis. For example, a work assignment can be fully office based, fully field based, fully home based, or some combination thereof

offerExtensionDate.description: The date a worker is extended an offer for a work assignment. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

seniorityDate.description: A date related to the length of time a worker works in a given work assignment or job. This is sometimes tracked at the work assignment level in support of union contracts. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

industryClassifications.description: The occupational classification reflects the type of job or work that the person does, while the industry classification reflects the business activity of their employer or company. The occupational and industry classifications are based on a persons sole or primary job, unless otherwise specified. For the unemployed, the occupation and industry are based on the last job held. An example of an industry classification code in the US is the NAICS code.

classificationCode.description: The classification code of the associated entity.

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

payrollGroupCode.description: The payroll group relevant to payroll processing for this work assignment

homeOrganizationalUnits.description: A list of the various types of home organizational units

items.description: The HOME organizational unit defines the work assignment and perhaps funds it. The should only be one home organizational unit for a given type, e.g. only one home department.
items.title: HomeOrganizationalUnitItem

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated organizational unit entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

typeCode.description: The organizational unit code and description, e.g. department code.

additionalRemunerations.description: A list of pay compensations associated to a given work assignment.  Additional remuneration includes all other forms of compensation beyond the base pay associated to a given work assignment.  The typeCode is used to further refine the type of compensation, e.g. bonus, commission, etc.

intervalCode.description: The interval describing how often the remuneration is paid

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

associatedRateQualifiers.description: Describes the conditions under which the associated rate can be expected

qualifierObjectTypeCode.description: Qualifier type e.g. department, environment, shift, etc.

effectiveDate.description: The effective date of the related entity. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format.

typeCode.description: The type of additional remuneration, e.g. bonus, commission, etc.

actualStartDate.description: The date the worker actually shows up for work. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

payCycleCode.description: Describes how often the payee is paid

stockOwnerIndicator.description: Indicates whether the worker is a stock owner. This may be used by regulatory bodies for tax purposes or for statutory reporting

assignmentStatus.description: The status of the work assignment

standardPayPeriodHours.description: The standard number of hours per pay period

baseRemuneration.description: The base or primary pay (i.e. salary, wage) associated to a work assignment. The structure allows for the explicit communication of pre-defined equivalents for the base remuneration

associatedRateQualifiers.description: Describes the conditions under which the associated rate can be expected

qualifierObjectTypeCode.description: Qualifier type e.g. department, environment, shift, etc.

recordingBasisCode.description: Describes how the remuneration is recorded in the given system, e.g. hourly, daily, weekly, etc.

effectiveDate.description: The effective date of the related entity. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format.

payGradeStepPayRate.description: The rate associated with the pay step

hireDate.description: The date the worker is hired into a work assignment. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

homeWorkLocation.description: The home work location is the location out of which the work assignment is based. It does not necessarily mean that the worker is physically located in that location. This data becomes relevant for affirmative action reasons. In the US for example, if a worker works from home or a location where there is not an EEO-1 form/location, then the worker is accounted for based on the location of the reports to manager or work unit. Additionally, other things like market salaries, taxes, etc. would be aligned to home office location

managementPositionIndicator.description: The value true indicates that this position may manage people i.e. it may have positiions that report to it.

reportsTo.description: A reference list of workers to whom a given worker reports

items.description: The work assignment to whom a given worker reports
items.title: WorkAssignmentReportsTo

workerID.description: An identifier for a worker, e.g. an Employee ID, a Contractor ID or an Associate ID.

positionID.description: The unique identifier of the associated position

reportsToWorkerName.description: Reports to person name (if reporting to a person)

associateOID.description: A unique identifier of an associate

nameCode.description: The location type code and description, e.g. HDQ, headquarters

workerTypeCode.description: This describes the type of the worker in a given work assignment, e.g. permanent employee, fixed term employee, apprentice, vendor employee, volunteer, apprentice, independent contractor, etc.

payrollRegionCode.description: The region in which the payroll is processed

geographicPayDifferentialCode.description: A geographic pay differential is additional compensation paid to a worker to account for variations in cost of labor or cost of living based on location and is expected to be communicated as an additional remuneration. This is a coded field that is associated to a percent that drives the calculation of that additional compensation. It is also used to modify the pay range associated to the pay grade in order to apply the appropriate adjustments to the compa ratio

payGradeCode.description: A pay grade is a breakdown of a pay scale that is used to manage the compensation of a worker by providing a  a fixed framework of salary or wage ranges, as opposed to a free negotiation

payGradePayRange.description: The pay range of the pay grade

offerAcceptanceDate.description: The date a worker accepts an offer for a work assignment. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

bargainingUnit.description: The associated bargaining unit (local labor union)
